All MR Games Are Currently Out Of Production, Buy What You Want NOW!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2003 Topics (Year of the Counter): All MR Games Are Currently Out Of Production, Buy What You Want NOW!
By Lisa Shock on Friday, March 28, 2003 - 11:49 pm:

I just spoke to the person at Tecmo responsible for placing production orders for games, and he told me that all MR games have been out of production for about 6 months. Some retailers still have copies in stock (I still see MR2 new at my local Gamestop store.), so buy whatever you have been contemplating getting, now!

I did tell them that people would like to see MR1 re-released sometime, maybe as part of a boxed set. He said that he would bring up the topic at a meeting, but that sort of thing takes time.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Saturday, March 29, 2003 - 09:15 am:

Wow. I guess I'd better get my copy of MR3 when I can. Thanks for the heads-up, Lisa. I'm pretty sure our favorite Nashville store has a copy or two used. Now I just need to talk the SO into a trip down that way...

By Djinnmastr on Monday, March 31, 2003 - 09:41 pm:

By Chris on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 12:27 pm:

I love my GBA-SP ...almost as much as MRA2

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 04:46 pm:

Don't forget that if you already owna game cube, there is an adapter coming out for it to play GBA games through the cube onto the tv, no GBA needed. People with bad eyes, or who prefer larger controllers will like it.
